entry.title: 5 Things You Didn‚Äôt Know About SAP Joule for Developers ‚Äî Plus an Exciting Update
entry.content:
Artificial intelligence is reshaping how we work, and developers are among the first to feel the impact. SAP Joule for Developers is a collection of AI capabilities in SAP Build and ABAP Environment designed to help developers build smarter, faster, and more intuitively ‚Äî whether you‚Äôre streamlining repetitive coding tasks or creating complex integrations. 

And here‚Äôs the big news: 
üëâThe free promotion for SAP Joule for Developers has been extended. 

That means you now have even more time to explore Joule, experiment with projects, and see firsthand how it can transform your workflows ‚Äî all at no cost. 

We are hosting an engaging webinar with demos, use cases and best practices on how to maximize value with Joule in SAP Build. Read till the end to find the registration link!

Without further ado, here are five things you might not know about SAP Joule for Developers. 

 

1. It‚Äôs More Than Just an AI Assistant 

Many developers see Joule as just a chatbot. But it‚Äôs far more powerful. Joule for Developers goes beyond simple answers ‚Äî it integrates into your workflow, generates context-aware code suggestions, and automates repetitive tasks. Whether you‚Äôre building in SAP Build, working in ABAP, or connecting with third-party services, Joule is designed to keep your productivity high. 

üëâLearn more about capabilities via our webpage 

 

2. It Speaks ‚ÄúDeveloper‚Äù Fluently 

Joule understands technical prompts and adapts its recommendations to your specific context. Describe what you want to create, and Joule can generate API calls, reusable code snippets, or even integration patterns tailored to your environment. 

üëâExplore a tutorial in ABAP here. 

 

3. Built-In Security and Compliance Awareness 

SAP Build‚Äîwith SAP Joule for Developers embedded‚Äîis built on enterprise-grade security. It adheres to SAP‚Äôs compliance standards, so your code and data are always protected. You can confidently experiment with AI in your workflows, backed by privacy, governance, and regulatory safeguards. 

üëâRead more about SAP‚Äôs approach to security and compliance in SAP Build and SAP Business Technology Platform. 

 

4. It Helps You Learn as You Build 

Joule isn‚Äôt just about solutions ‚Äî it‚Äôs about learning. As you code, Joule explains the why behind its suggestions. This helps developers discover new frameworks, understand best practices, and ramp up on unfamiliar technologies faster. 

Think of it as a mentor who‚Äôs always available, providing guidance while letting you stay in the driver‚Äôs seat. 

üëâTry a tutorial on how to create CAP application in SAP Build. 

 

5. It Works Across Your Development Stack 

Joule isn‚Äôt limited to a single tool or environment. Whether you‚Äôre generating processes or building applications, SAP Joule for Developers can support you. This flexibility means you can bring AI assistance into the environments you already know ‚Äî without having to change how you work. 

 

Free Access to SAP Joule for Developers 

Now is the best time to explore, innovate, and see how Joule can transform the way you build ‚Äî without worrying about cost. 

üëâGet started today.  

üìÖMark your calendar: Join our upcoming SAP Build with Joule webinar on September 24th to see live demos, best practices, and how to maximize the value of Joule in your projects. Register here.

entry.title: Using Document AI Premium in SAP Build Process Automation
entry.content:
Intro

SAP Document AI, previously known as Document Information Extraction or DOX, has been bundled in SAP Build Process Automation (SBPA) for many years. The bundled document extraction capabilities in SBPA are leveraging Document AI Base edition based on Machine Learning. Since the introduction of the LLM-based Document AI Premium, there are many cases where the Premium version is the best and prefered option, or you may want to combine both versions. Although SAP Document AI Premium can be connected to SBPA via API like any other BTP service, this still poses a challenge for many SBPA users, who expect a no-code activity similar to the bundled version (DOX SDK).
In this blog post, I will explain how to quickly leverage Document AI Premium in your process automation projects using a reusable package that we deploy in our proof-of-concept activities.

Prerequisites

The assumption is that you have a Document AI Premium service and destination configured on your SBPA subaccount. If not, please check the quick setup tips below and find detailed instructions in SAP Help:

  • Document AI Premium service: You should setup Document AI Premium in your BTP environment (can be on any subbacount). For CloudFoundry, easiest way is to use booster.
  • Destination: You should create a destionation, with all required additonal properties for SBPA, in the subbacount where you SAP Build Process Automation is activated and add it to your Build tenant. Easiest way to create a destionation is to download this example and import into your BTP cockpit. You should update 4 parameters (Client ID, Client Secret, Token Service URL and URL) with values from your Document AI Service key.  

Easiest way to start

I will first cover the simplest way to get started with Document AI Premium in your automation process, which will work for most users. The goal is to quickly enable the capability to add an activity that will synchronously call your Document AI Premium. 

You need to download the latest version of the reusable DocAI Premium package from this link (download the latest version of MTAR file called "(package) Document AI service") and import it into your SAP Build Lobby:

Once the reusable package is uploaded, go to "versions" and select "Publish to Library". Once published, the package will be available to all developers on this tenant.

Open or create an automation project and add this package as a dependency (very similar to the way you add standard SBPA SDK packages):

 

Now you have the reusable automation 'DocAI - Extract with Schema' in your project, which you can simply drag and drop into your automation flow. You can ignore the other automations for now, as they are meant for advanced cases that I will cover separately. For most users, they are not relevant.

There are 2 input parameters: "fileToUpload" and "schemaName".

"File to upload" is self-explanatory; just provide a local path to a document that you want to process with the Document AI Premium service. "Schema name" refers to any SAP standard or custom schema that is created in your Document AI Premium. Make sure to use the exact name of any standard or custom schema.

And that's it. Once you run your autmation, there will be 3 output parameters that you can use:

  • fullResponse: Exact full output from the Document AI service (e.g., confidence level, page, coordinates, etc.)
  • extractedData:Simplified response with only the header and line items fields of your schema. This output is useful if you just want to map extracted data to your Action call, any API or BAPI call, or quickly map exact schema key values.
  • Status: Status of the extracted document. This field is here for simplification. The status is anyway returned in the fullResponse.status where you can also find additional details if there is a failure. For example, the document may have a valid extension but is corrupted, which will result in a "FAILED" status. To handle this, you can add IF logic after extraction and simply check if the Status == "FAILED" and then take appropriate action.

You can see the difference between the two output responses in the example below:

Notes for advanced automation users

You can double-click on the automation "DocAI - Extract with Schema" and see how this automation works. You will notice that it's uploading the document and waiting for the Document AI Premium service response. You can use the upload automation to send a document to the service, and then start a process that will wait for the service response and continue with the process flow. This asynchronous approach will help you process many more documents with one unattended connection compared to the typical synchronous automation. I will cover this in a separate post, but here is the concept:

You can also activate or deactivate the Instant Learning capability of your Document AI Premium with the automations provided in the package. There is no need to deploy anything. Just add the automations to an empty project and run them in test mode.

For those of you who are familiar with reusable packages (Library) and understand the implications of deploying a new version of your own, here is the editable version of this package so you can adjust it for your specific needs. I don‚Äôt advise doing that if you are not familiar with Library concepts and all implications of import and export activities.

Conclusion

I hope this package will speed up and simplify your automation projects with Document AI Premium. Package supports both Windows and Mac OS desktop agents. Let me know how it works for you in the comments below. 

I plan to cover the following topics in upcoming posts:

  • Example automation projects that are leveraging this package
  • Asynchronous approach for faster processing of large volumes of documents
  • How to combine new Document AI Workspaces with SAP Build Process Automation

Also, feel free to ask if you want me to cover other topics or if you would like to know more about SAP Document AI Premium combined with SAP Build Process Automation.

entry.title: SAP BTP: Creating Connections at Supply Chain Connect
entry.content:
There‚Äôs excitement building in the SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP) team, as we get ready for the SAP Connect event, which will run from 6-8 October in Las Vegas. Of course, SAP Connect is different this year, with five events offered in one location, where attendees can enjoy a conference experience focused on their own Line of Business. Three of my colleagues have already been busy publishing blogs about SAP BTP topics you‚Äôll be able to find at the conference, ijoaquin on Spend Management, rnoia on HCM and joanneks focusing on technology topics. Not wishing to feel left out, I thought that I would share a blog that focuses on my area of interest, SAP BTP for Supply Chain.

In working with my SAP Supply Chain Management colleagues on topics for the Supply Chain Connect event, we‚Äôve decided to focus on SAP BTP capabilities that go to the heart of a ‚Äúconnected‚Äù supply chain, where integration and automation are key to creating agility and resilience. It will be of little surprise therefore that it is these very two topics that will be featured in sessions at the event.

Creating Connections

Integration is key to creating connectivity across supply chain systems and processes, and as such I would like to invite you to join my colleague, Craig Stasila, in two sessions where he will take a look at how SAP Integration Suite might be able to help you create a more connected, and collaborative supply chain:

SCM1886: Optimize your supply chain processes with SAP BTP | 7 Oct, 12:00PM ‚Äì 12:20PM

In this session Craig will discuss how SAP BTP can help to unlock the potential for creating additional business value across supply chain processes.

SCM2278: Connecting the dots: A collaborative integration workshop | 7 Oct, 3:30PM ‚Äì 4:45PM

Here Craig will lead an interactive workshop designed to get you thinking about how systems link together and how to get the most out of your approaches to integration. I think you‚Äôll enjoy this one, so don‚Äôt miss it!

Automate for Efficiency

Automation and extension are two technology capabilities that can have a dramatic and positive effect on the efficiency, accuracy and productivity of business processes, as you‚Äôll see if you attend this session led by my colleague Loujein Mouammer:

SCM1891 - Reimagine supply chain processes with automation and custom extensions | Oct 8, 12:00PM ‚Äì 12:20PM

Here Loujein will take you through a demonstration of how automation and extension can help improve operational processes and drive better business outcomes.

Build Your Own Connections with the SAP Team

If you are attending SAP Connect this year, then while I‚Äôm sure that you‚Äôll enjoy the SAP BTP sessions delivered by Loujein and Craig, if you are curious to learn more, why not take the opportunity to connect directly with members of the SAP BTP team, and delve into the topics of Integration, Automation and Extensibility a little more deeply. You‚Äôll find the team located at our demo stations on the show floor, and I know that they‚Äôll be excited to speak with you:

CROSS2318 | Connect the enterprise with SAP Integration Suite

CROSS2319 | Create AI agents and apps with SAP Build solutions

Of course if you‚Äôre unable to join the live event, then please consider joining the online event and experience SAP Connect Virtual from the comfort of your own office.

However you decide to attend, in-person or online, then I do hope you find SAP Connect to be a truly inspirational and rewarding experience. And of course ‚Äì enjoy all the SAP BTP sessions!

2. SAP Build Process Automation con IA generativa

SAP Build Process Automation incorpora IA generativa para que usuarios de negocio dise√±en flujos sin necesidad de c√≥digo. Un CFO o analista puede describir un proceso en lenguaje natural y el sistema genera el flujo base. Arquitectos y desarrolladores ajustan la l√≥gica para robustecerlo. Esto acelera la entrega de valor en procesos clave. El reto ser√° equilibrar agilidad con gobernanza y control.

Ventajas :

 

  • Democratiza la automatizaci√≥n para √°reas de negocio.
  • Reduce tiempos de entrega de procesos digitales.

3. SAP Business Network sobre SAP BTP

La red de colaboraci√≥n SAP Business Network se integra m√°s fuerte a BTP. Esto habilita trazabilidad, compliance e IA nativos en la red. Los procesos con proveedores y compradores ganan sincron√≠a. Pero aumenta la complejidad de gobernanza y onboarding de socios. La adopci√≥n depende tambi√©n de la madurez de cada partner.

  • Mayor transparencia en la cadena de suministro.
  • Procesos m√°s √°giles entre m√∫ltiples organizaciones.

4. Innovaciones de AI en SAP Integration Suite

Integration Suite ahora sugiere mapas de integraci√≥n y detecta conflictos autom√°ticamente. Se anuncia un ‚Äúadaptador AI‚Äù para conectar LLM externos. Esto acelera los ciclos de integraci√≥n con recomendaciones en tiempo real. Permite prever consumos de API y anticipar cuellos de botella. Los equipos deber√°n validar sugerencias de la IA para asegurar calidad.

Ventajas :

 

  • Reduce tiempos de desarrollo y testing.
  • Anticipa problemas antes de que impacten la operaci√≥n.
  • Facilita integraciones complejas con IA como copiloto.

 

üîó M√°s informaci√≥n

¬øConfiar√≠as en una IA para dise√±ar mapas de integraci√≥n productivos?

5. Estrategia ‚ÄúClean Core + extensibilidad con BTP‚Äù

La idea central es mantener el core SAP est√°ndar y mover extensiones a BTP. Esto evita deuda t√©cnica y facilita upgrades en el core. Implica redise√±ar l√≠mites entre procesos est√°ndar y diferenciadores. Las extensiones requieren su propia gobernanza y testing. Es un cambio cultural y t√©cnico importante.

Ventajas :

 

  • Facilita actualizaciones del core.
  • Permite innovar sin comprometer estabilidad.
  • Reduce costos de mantenimiento a largo plazo.

 

üîó M√°s informaci√≥n

6. Gobernanza de datos en entornos BTP h√≠bridos

La mezcla de datos SAP y no SAP en BTP exige un modelo de gobierno s√≥lido. Es clave definir roles, propiedad y calidad del dato maestro. La replicaci√≥n entre entornos puede generar inconsistencias si no se dise√±a bien. Se deben cumplir regulaciones locales y globales de privacidad. El lineage del dato ser√° un diferenciador en auditor√≠as.

Ventajas :

 

  • Mayor confianza en reportes y decisiones.
  • Cumplimiento m√°s sencillo ante auditor√≠as.
  • Reducci√≥n de duplicaciones e inconsistencias.

 

üîó M√°s informaci√≥n

¬øPrefer√≠s un modelo √∫nico de datos o m√∫ltiples vistas seg√∫n √°rea de negocio?

7. Adopci√≥n de BTP en industrias reguladas

Industrias reguladas exigen trazabilidad, certificaciones y seguridad extrema. SAP NS2 propone un marco espec√≠fico para implementar BTP en estos entornos. Esto incluye segregaci√≥n de ambientes y auditor√≠a constante. El cumplimiento requiere alineaci√≥n entre IT, compliance y negocio. No todas las regulaciones est√°n actualizadas al modelo cloud.

Ventajas :

 

  • Confianza de auditores y entes reguladores.
  • Menor riesgo legal y reputacional.
  • Innovaci√≥n cloud en sectores tradicionalmente r√≠gidos.

entry.title: What‚Äôs New in SAP Build ‚Äì Q3 2025 Release Highlights
entry.content:
In Q3, we delivered several innovations across AI-powered development, ABAP project creation, modernized SAPUI5 and advanced mobile capabilities. SAP Build also reached a significant milestone with the introduction of MCP servers, allowing developers to boost productivity further with AI agents. 

Check these out in our Top 10 Release Highlights from Q3 2025! 

AI-powered development

1. Empowering developers with MCP Tools for SAP Build 

Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers are now available for the following technologies: SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP), SAPUI5 and SAP Fiori. This is a huge step forward for developers working with popular IDEs and coding assistants like GitHub Copilot, Cursor and more. With these MCP servers, we‚Äôre now providing a comprehensive set of tools designed to optimize your development workflow across various SAP technologies.

Learn more in the blog post.

2. SAP HANA Cloud SQL Statement Generation in Joule

Directly in SAP Build Code, the Joule panel now offers the new command /hana-sql-gen, which enables the generation of SQL statements from natural language directly in the panel. The generated statements can be reviewed and refined in the Joule panel. Suitable SQL statements can be either copied to a SQL console or directly executed inside the Joule panel after selecting a database connection on which to run the statement.

3. Expanded AI-powered capabilities in SAP Build Work Zone

SAP Build Work Zone continues to expand its AI capabilities, bringing new built-in features to an intelligent workspace with accelerated decision-making and improved employee experiences:

  • Integration of Joule in SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition: By bringing Joule into SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition, users can now enjoy the power of Joule within their digital workplace. This eliminates the hassle of system-hopping, reduces time wasted on searching for information, and allows employees to focus on what is important. (Note: Available in early October)
  • AI-powered text and comment generation: This enables employees to quickly create, summarize, and engage with workplace content. For example, project managers can generate project status updates in minutes, ensuring their team members stay aligned.

Learn more in the blog post.

Enhanced App Development & Automation

4. Availability of SAPUI5 1.136.x-legacy-free with deprecated code removed 

SAPUI5 1.136.x-legacy-free with deprecated code removed is now available via cloud access. This means app developers can test their UI code for compliance to SAPUI5 best practices. This helps to future-proof an SAP Fiori app for future SAPUI5 versions and work on deprecated/outdated code. Developers can also provide feedback to the UI5 team.

Learn more in the blog post.

5. Create full-stack ABAP projects in SAP Build

You can now create full-stack ABAP projects or open an existing ABAP CSN as a project in SAP Build. You can also model your application using the CDS Graphical Modeler and generate ABAP development objects. By leveraging high productivity tools, this significantly accelerates time-to-market, improves collaboration and provides a standardized, compliant approach to building extensions.

Learn more in the Help Portal. ..And stay tuned! We‚Äôll share more about this topic at SAP TechEd 2025.

6. Maintenance project for released process automation projects

For process automation, we‚Äôve introduced the ability to create dedicated project versions based on an existing released version. This allows process owners to maintain parallel editable versions while keeping the latest version in place, enabling teams to focus on solving a problem without redoing everything from scratch.

Learn more in the Help Portal.

7. Outbox functionality for tasks in SAP Task Center

SAP Task Center, which provides a seamless user experience for accessing open tasks, now lets you view completed tasks in an outbox. This provides a complete view of historical data while reducing support requests and efforts around process automation instances.

New innovations for mobile

8. UI enhancements available for mobile development

The latest release of SAP Mobile Development Kit (MDK) is now available to customers, bringing with it multiple enhancements for UI creation. Developers can add a date range to their calendar controls, enable a read-only state, add required fields to forms, and much more.

Learn more in the latest blog post.

9. Support for new site experience in SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition 

Employees accessing their workspace content via SAP Mobile Start can now enjoy a new view mode with a more flexible structuring of content. They can quickly view workspace updates, company news or project dashboards, making it easier to organize and consume information in a personalized way. (Note: Available in early October)

 

10. Updates to SAP Mobile Start

As the native mobile entry point to all SAP business apps and content, SAP Mobile Start has released several new innovations that simplify employee tasks and optimize their user experience:

  • SAP Document AI integration: Allows users to upload documents and photos for automated processing. This streamlines document handling, cuts down manual work and ensures data accuracy throughout operations.
  • Enhanced push notifications with more detailed information: Load and display context-specific details directly in the push notification, providing more meaningful and informative messages.
  • Simplified onboarding via deep link: IT teams can invite users to onboard to SAP Mobile Start via an email or message and provide a deep link that the users can use to initiate a simplified onboarding process.
  • Top news on start screen: Shows the most important news in a larger format on top of the Start screen.

Learn more in the latest blog post and Help Portal.

Ready to see these in action?

Join us for the next What‚Äôs New in SAP Build Webinar on October 8th as we dive deeper into MCP servers in CAP, SAP Mobile Start innovations, and much more!

Sign up today for your preferred option:
üåêOctober 8th, 9:00-10:00am CEST (EMEA/APJ friendly): Register here
üåêOctober 8th, 5:00-6:00pm CEST (Americas friendly): Register here

entry.title: SAP Sustainability Footprint Management: Q3-25 Updates & Highlights
entry.content:
In the past quarter, we continued delivering many more useful features and functions in SAP Sustainability Footprint Management, and we achieved great success stories together with our customers. This blog post continues my quarterly series and gives you an overview of some of the highlights. In this edition, I‚Äôm covering:

  • ERP-Centric Transport Footprint Calculation
  • Manage Footprint Results ‚Äì Source Input Items
  • GHG Data Collection API and SAP Build Process Automation
  • Onboarding Booster
  • Other Release Highlights
  • Customer Success Stories: KNAPP & Tyrolit
  • Upcoming Partner Webinars
  • Additional Information

 

ERP-Centric Transport Footprint Calculation

Transportation can be a major contributor to Scope 3 emissions, yet calculating its impact has mostly been complex and manual. With the new ERP‚Äëcentric transport footprint calculation, SAP Sustainability Footprint Management introduces a capability that leverages your existing ERP master and transactional data to automate and scale transport emission calculations. This means you can move from spreadsheets and estimates to actual, auditable results that integrate seamlessly into both corporate and product carbon footprints.

Instead of building transport models from scratch, the solution now derives upstream and internal transport activities from Goods Receipt from Supplier, Goods Return to Supplier, and Goods Transfer data, and then calculates the footprint per activity, route, and leg. In practical terms, a transport activity is determined as the movement of specific products in given quantities between two locations under defined conditions. The system brings together master data, transaction details, and transport settings to identify source and target locations, the mode of transport, and whether goods move under ambient or temperature-controlled conditions. It then builds optimal transport routes via connection points such as airports, seaports, inland ports, and railway stations, before applying the relevant emission factors to calculate the footprint.

 

In the following, I‚Äôll briefly summarize the required process steps and introduce the new apps. For detailed information, see Calculating Transport Footprints Using Business Transactions.

To use the new approach, start with importing transport-relevant master data, so routing and distances work out-of-the-box. Products now carry a Custom Temperature Condition, and SAP provides a default mapping to Ambient. If you need temperature-controlled transport, create your own custom conditions and map them to the standard values (Ambient or Temperature-Controlled). Locations and Plants now support addresses and geo-coordinates, and Business Partners can be imported with Supplier and Carrier roles, including address data tied to supplier IDs.

Then you can configure your inventory scope and in Transport Details set the Data Source to Standard (Business Transactions). Newly created scopes default to Standard, while existing scopes remain on Classic until you switch them.

For maintaining transport connection points ‚Äì like seaports, inland ports, airports, railway stations ‚Äì go to the Manage Locations app, where you already find SAP-delivered content for seaports and airports to help kick-start sea and air routes.

Next, configure how goods typically move in your network with the new Manage Transport Settings app. Define haul types and distances ‚Äì short haul defaults to 1500 km and can be adapted ‚Äì and specify the primary mode of transport from supplier locations to one or all plants, optionally by product group. The same supplier-to-plant mode applies to returns back to the supplier. For internal logistics, create directional settings for movements between plants.

With settings in place, use the new Manage Transport Activities app to generate transport activities for your chosen scope and period from the ERP transactions. Once activities are clean, generate the corresponding routes and legs. In case of inconsistencies, the app guides you with messages helping you to resolve before calculation.

Emission factors for the different modes of transport are managed in the new Manage Transport Operation Footprints app, and you can maintain them in the UI directly or import via file.

Finally, run the transport calculation in the new Calculate Transport Footprints app and review results per activity, route, and leg.

In the Calculate Footprints app, the Data Readiness tab lists transport data as one of the data types. Transport is now a first-class citizen across the analytics experience. In organizational footprint inventories, transport data becomes mandatory whenever your scope uses Standard and transport-relevant value chain steps are enabled. Transport footprints are created as input items to products, if a carrier is specified, the corresponding business partner footprint is used as the utilized item, otherwise the input is shown as Unknown Carrier. You can see transport-related product and business partner items in the Manage Footprint Results app, and analyze Scope 3.4 emissions in depth in the Footprint Overview app.

A quick note on provisioning: The new apps require explicit role assignment, role names are case-sensitive, and write access requires both read and write roles. If you‚Äôre moving from the classic transport approach, reimport your enhanced master data for Plants, Business Partners, Products, and relevant Locations via file or API, then switch your inventory scopes to Standard (Business Transactions). Keep scopes on Classic if you plan to recalculate them using the classic transport apps. With these pieces in place, the new transport calculation streamlines data preparation, strengthens routing fidelity, and brings transport emissions seamlessly into your product and corporate footprint story.

 

Manage Footprint Results ‚Äì Source Input Items

For decarbonizing your company and products, it‚Äôs crucial to have full transparency into what‚Äôs actually driving emissions across the value chain. While total product footprints are useful, they often leave a critical question unanswered: Where exactly do these emissions come from? Without that level of granularity, it‚Äôs difficult to identify hotspots, prioritize reduction efforts, or make informed decisions that lead to real impact. To address this, SAP Sustainability Footprint Management now includes a new feature in the Manage Footprint Results app: Source Input Items. This enhancement gives you a detailed view into the specific inputs that contribute to a product‚Äôs environmental footprint ‚Äì enabling smarter, data-driven strategies for decarbonization.

 

Source input items represent the materials, energy, transport, and other resources used at the start of a process that result in emissions. With just a click on Generate, you can now explore these contributors for each footprint item (excluding items of type business partner, work in progress, production documents, and supplier). Note that source input items currently cannot yet be generated for calculation results involving cycles, this will be added in a future release.

The app provides you with various charts that instantly visualize emissions across lifecycle stages such as material acquisition, production, transport, and end-of-life treatment. These charts help you pinpoint the most emission-intensive stages and align your analysis with the GHG Protocol. You can also customize the view to match your specific reporting or decision-making needs. Below the chart, a consolidated table provides full transparency into each source input item.

With this enhancement, SAP Sustainability Footprint Management strengthens its role as an intuitive product fact sheet, empowering you to go beyond high-level metrics. You can now trace emissions to their source, understand their context, and take targeted action ‚Äì whether that means switching suppliers, optimizing logistics, or redesigning products. For all information, see Viewing the Footprint Results on SAP Help.

 

GHG Data Collection API and SAP Build Process Automation

One of the recurring challenges in tracking greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions is the complexity and scale of data collection. Sustainability teams often need to gather activity and spend data from various business units, geographies, or partner organizations. To address these hurdles, we now released the GHG Data Forms API. This new public API empowers you to extend and tailor the GHG data collection process far beyond the core application: External workflows, survey applications, or even mobile apps can now retrieve, maintain, and push data directly into the GHG Data Forms in SAP Sustainability Footprint Management. By decentralizing and parallelizing how and where environmental data is gathered, you can drive faster, more automated, and more consistent emission data capture across your full operational or organizational boundary. For technical details and integration guidelines, refer to the official API documentation on SAP Business Accelerator Hub.

One powerful example of leveraging this API is through SAP Build Process Automation. With SAP Build workflows, you can automate and streamline sustainability data collection across multiple locations. The process begins by triggering a workflow, either manually or on a scheduled basis, then retrieving all relevant business activities and locations from SAP Sustainability Footprint Management using the API. Through parallel subprocesses for each location, you can enable simultaneous data collection and significantly reduce cycle time. Business users receive customizable forms ‚Äì survey-style via SAP Build or ticket-style via SAP Task Center ‚Äì delivered directly to the right people based on responsibility rules, with built-in notifications and reminders to keep the process moving. Once data is submitted, it‚Äôs routed for approval, and after validation, posted back to SAP Sustainability Footprint Management and included into the overall footprint calculation. This approach provides flexibility, scalability, and compliance, helping sustainability teams focus on insights rather than manual tasks.

 

 

Onboarding Booster

With the introduction of the Onboarding Booster, we‚Äôre speeding up the time required for setting up am SAP Sustainability Footprint Management tenant on SAP BTP. The entire onboarding can now be completed in about 10 to 15 minutes through a guided, automated process. The booster is integrated into the SAP BTP cockpit and walks you through the essential steps: checking prerequisites, selecting the identity service, and either creating or choosing a subaccount. Once these steps are confirmed, the system takes over and performs the necessary configurations in the background. The result is a fully prepared environment that is ready for role assignment and productive use. This is more than just a time saver, it reduces complexity and lowers the barrier for customers to get started quickly and confidently. For detailed guidance, the full procedure is documented in our Help Portal: Setting Up Using Booster.

 

Other Release Highlights

We‚Äôve redesigned the SAP Fiori Launchpad Structure for a more intuitive experience. New app groups offer logical organization, simplifying navigation and helping you to quickly find what you need. For more information, see Enhanced SAP Fiori Launchpad Structure.

You can now assign different location types (not just plants) to a single business activity, expanding flexibility, supporting more accurate form generation, and ensuring that business activities can be valid across multiple locations. See Creating Business Activities for more information.

Additionally, when setting your footprint inventory scope, plant assignments now ensure that only relevant forms are generated for your selected companies and locations. This prevents the creation of irrelevant forms, enhancing efficiency and streamlining the data collection process. Learn more here: Creating Business Activities.

 

Customer Success Stories

KNAPP AG, a global leader in intralogistics and warehouse automation, faced new challenges with the EU‚Äôs Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD), which raised the bar for ESG transparency. Instead of waiting for deadlines, KNAPP acted early, building a strong sustainability data foundation with SAP Sustainability solutions. Partnering with KPMG Austria, KNAPP implemented SAP Sustainability Footprint Management and SAP Sustainability Control Tower to replace manual reporting with automated, integrated processes. These solutions consolidated over 200 sustainability metrics from across the business, delivering advanced carbon footprint calculations at both product and corporate levels. This gave KNAPP unprecedented visibility into emissions, resource use, and overall ESG impact. With audit-ready reporting in place, KNAPP achieved CSRD compliance well ahead of schedule and embedded sustainability insights into daily operations and strategic planning. This proactive approach turned compliance into a catalyst for transformation, accelerating their ‚Äúnow4tomorrow‚Äù program and ensuring their first sustainability report complements financial disclosures. Read the full story: Getting ahead of regulatory reporting to steer business process transformation.

Tyrolit is a global leader in abrasive tools and construction systems that operates across 48 companies and exports to 140+ countries. Also facing growing demands for transparent ESG reporting under CSRD, Tyrolit needed to move beyond fragmented systems and spreadsheets that made standardization and auditability difficult. To address this, Tyrolit deployed SAP Sustainability Footprint Management and SAP Sustainability Control Tower, integrated via SAP Business Technology Platform. This centralized ESG data collection from SAP and third-party systems, aligned sustainability reporting with financial standards, and enabled advanced analytics for benchmarking and target setting. AI-powered automation reduced manual work, improved accuracy, and provided dashboards for 60+ managers to monitor 80+ ESG metrics. This resulted in measurable carbon reductions, less plastic packaging, and higher recycling rates. Tyrolit now uses data-driven insights to identify emission-saving opportunities and embed sustainability across the organization. Check the full story: Tooling up to unlock the sustainable value chain with a robust ESG data foundation.

 

Upcoming Partner Webinars

Staying ahead means staying informed, and this quarter again brings two opportunities exclusively for our partners to connect and learn more about SAP Sustainability Footprint Management. Both webinars are free for partners with a valid SAP Learning Hub license.

The SAP Business Suite Product Expert Training is a biannual event designed to empower partners with in-depth product know-how, practical guidance, and the latest innovations across SAP Cloud ERP, the SAP Business Suite, AI-powered features, and more. On October 10, you can learn more about the latest updates in SAP Sustainability Footprint Management, SAP Sustainability Control Tower, and SAP Sustainability Data Exchange. Register for the session here: Sustainability Management and Carbon Accounting. For an overview of all sessions and their respective registration links check out: SAP Business Suite Product Expert Training 2025.

On November 5, the Meet the Expert Session returns. This highly interactive webinar is your chance to bring questions directly to the SAP experts from the Product Management and Customer Adoption teams. Gain practical insights, obtain answers to your questions, and deepen your expertise in SAP Sustainability Footprint Management. Register here: SAP Sustainability Footprint Management - Meet the Expert Q4 2025.

 

Additional Information

To learn more on how you can enhance the accuracy of your Scope 3.1 emissions reporting by transitioning from broad average data to precise, supplier-specific actuals, you should check out the blog post Implementing an Average to Actuals Strategy for Scope 3.1 by @CButzlaff. This article outlines a practical, phased approach for implementing this strategy using SAP Sustainability Footprint Management and SAP Sustainability Data Exchange.

For a comprehensive guide on how to embed carbon accounting into your ERP and finance processes, have a look into the new SAP PRESS book Carbon Accounting for Sustainability with SAP. It explains how to capture sustainability data across your ERP landscape, calculate product- and company-level carbon footprints, and integrate results into finance through SAP Green Ledger. You‚Äôll also learn how SAP Sustainability Data Exchange and SAP Sustainability Footprint Management enable accurate, auditable carbon data for decision-making and reporting.

For in-depth details on SAP Sustainability Footprint Management, including concepts, setup, and the application help, I recommend you browsing through the SAP Help Portal. For an overview of all new features and functions that have been released, check the What‚Äôs New section, which is updated with every new software release.

For exploring and experimenting in a live system, register for the free SAP Sustainability Footprint Management Trial. You‚Äôll receive an e-mail with access information within seconds after your registration and can then test the solution at your own convenience within a 30-day trial period. It also includes a wide range of guided tours designed to help you navigate through all the features and functions comprehensively. Recently, we also added new tours and will shortly release additional ones, representing the latest features and an enhanced user experience.

To stay up to date on SAP Sustainability Footprint Management, follow me here in the SAP Community. In regular cadence, I‚Äôll publish blog posts giving you updates on all the product‚Äôs new features and functions as well as deep dives into the product capabilities. I‚Äôm also looking forward to engaging with you directly, feel free to leave your feedback in the comment section.

entry.title: What‚Äôs new in Mobile development kit client 25.9
entry.content:
Dear Community,

I am happy to announce that a new release of the Mobile Development Kit (MDK) is now available for all SAP Build (and Mobile Services) customers. You can download it from the SAP Software Center, and also available on the community Download page.

The SAP Mobile Services Client has been updated to version 25.9.0 on both the Google Play Store and the Apple App Store.

SAP Mobile Development Kit enables developers and technical business users to build cross-platform mobile applications. It allows you to build your application once, in an integrated development environment (SAP Business Application Studio / VSCode extension) and run it natively on Mobile (Android & iOS).  

Below UI enhancements are available only on iOS and Android platforms:

  • Support Date Range Selection in Calendar Control
  • Support Event Indicators in Calendar Control
  • Support Read-Only State in FormCell Attachment Control
  • Support Attachment Limit in FormCell Attachment Control
  • Support Required Field Indicators for FormCell Controls
  • Introduce Additional Properties in Timeline Cell Control
  • Support Viewing Password-Protected PDFs in Native File Viewer (Android only)
  • Enable Nested Scrolling on SectionExtension (Android only)

Support Date Range Selection in Calendar Control 

MDK now supports date range selection in the Calendar Section control, in addition to single-date selection. The date range selection displays the calendar in a month-view format and allows multiple months to be shown. Users can scroll vertically through the calendar months. Use this option to enable the selection of a continuous date range.

  • The first date selected becomes the start date of the range.
  • The second date selected becomes the end date of the range.
//excerpt of an MDK page
{
    "Height": 0,
    "EventLoadRange": 1,
    "OnSelectedDateRangeChange": "/MDK2509/Rules/Calendar/OnSelectedDateRangeChange.js",
    "_Type": "Section.Type.Calendar",
    "_Name": "Calendar",
    "Header": {
        "_Type": "SectionCommon.Type.Header",
        "_Name": "SectionCommonTypeHeader0",
        "Caption": "Caption",
        "Items": [{
            "_Type": "SectionHeaderItem.Type.Label",
            "_Name": "SectionHeaderItemTypeLabel0",
            "Title": "Range Selection"
        }]
    },
    "CalendarType": "DateRange",
    "StartDayOfWeek": "Sun",
    "IsPersistentSelection": true
},

Additional Features:  

  • OnSelectedDateRangeChange event: This event is triggered when the selected date range is changed.
  • getSelectedDateRange / setSelectedDateRange APIs: These APIs allow you to get or set selected date range programmatically via CalendarProxy.

Platform Behavior

  • iOS:
    • To modify the selected range, tap any selected date within the range. That date becomes the new end date, and all later dates are deselected.
    • To clear the selection, tap outside the selected range anywhere in the calendar view.
  • Android:
    • Tapping any date‚Äîwhether within or outside the selected range‚Äîwill select that date.

Date Range Selection in Calendar Control on iOS and Android

For more information, refer to the Calendar documentation.

Support Event Indicators in Calendar Control

MDK now supports identifying special events or statuses directly on the calendar. This feature helps users to quickly spot important dates and plan more effectively. Indicators can have customizable appearances and can be assigned statically (via metadata) or dynamically (at runtime), providing an efficient way to manage and view calendar events.

//excerpt of an MDK page
 {
  "_Type": "Section.Type.Calendar",
  "_Name": "Calendar",
  "CalendarType": "Month",
  "StartDayOfWeek": "Sun",
  "IsPersistentSelection": true,
  "Height": 0,
  "EventLoadRange": 1,
  "Indicators": [{
    "_Name": "StartDateIndicator",
    "Icon": "sap-icon://begin",
    "Styles": {
      "Icon": "BlueIndicator"
    },
    "Title": "Start Date"
  }, {
    "_Name": "DueDateIndicator",
    "Icon": "sap-icon://project-definition-triangle-2",
    "Styles": {
      "Icon": "RedIndicator"
    },
    "Title": "Due Date"
  }],
  "Events": "/MDK2509/Rules/Calendar/GetEventData.js"
}

Event Indicator in Calendar Control on iOS and Android

 

For more information, refer to the Event Indicator documentation.

Support Read-Only State in FormCell Attachment Control 

MDK now supports restricting attachment management within a FormCell Attachment control. When disabled, the control automatically hides the Add button as well as the Remove (or delete) option for each attachment.

 

This behavior is controlled via the IsEditable property in the metadata, which accepts a boolean value.

"IsEditable": true

You can control this dynamically at runtime using the setEditable() and getEditable() APIs in a rule.

formcell.setEditable(true)
editable = formcell.getEditable()

Support Attachment Limit in FormCell Attachment Control

  • Maximum File Size: You can also configure the maximum file size (in MB) allowed for each attachment added to the FormCell Attachment control. If not specified, or set to a value less than or equal to 0, no file size limit is enforced.
//excerpt of an MDK page 
{
  "_Type": "Control.Type.FormCell.Attachment",
  "_Name": "InitialLimits",
  "IsEditable": true,
  "MaxAttachments": 2,
  "MaxFileSize": 1,
  "AttachmentActionType": ["AddPhoto", "TakePhoto", "SelectFile"],
  "AttachmentTitle": "Initial Values (%d)"
},‚Äã
  • Maximum Attachment Count: You can now configure FormCell Attachment control to restrict how many attachments a user can upload. Once the specified limit is reached, the control disables the Add button to prevent further uploads.
    In metadata, configure the maximum limit using the MaxAttachments property.
"MaxAttachments": 4‚Äã

Note:

  • If the property is not configured‚Äîor is set to zero or a negative value‚Äîno limit is enforced by default. 
  • Platform behavior: 
    • iOS: The limit is applied directly to the native file picker, which prevents additional file selection once the maximum is reached.
    • Android: The native file picker does not restrict selection. Users may select more files than allowed, but only the first N attachments (where N is the configured limit) are retained after confirmation. 

 

At runtime, you can set or query the limit using the APIs (setMaxAttachments and getMaxAttachments . 

attachment.setMaxAttachments(4);  
maxAttachments = attachment.getMaxAttachments();

Support Required Field Indicators  for FormCell Controls 

This feature allows developers to add a Mandatory Fields Indicator to FormCell controls, indicating that the field must be filled out.

Note: This feature does not enforce the user to fill out the form cell‚Äîit only provides visual indicator that the field is required.

By default, the indicator is a red asterisk (*) placed at the end of the caption. Developers can customize this indicator by specifying a different character in the metadata using the RequiredIndicator property.

  • Only a single character is allowed for customization.
  • If more than one character is defined, the system will revert to using the default indicator. 
  • Additionally, the appearance of the indicator can be styled through metadata.

//excerpt of an MDK page
{
   "Value": "Enter Date",
   "_Type": "Control.Type.FormCell.DatePicker",
   "_Name": "fcDatePicker",
   "RequiredIndicator": true,
   "Caption": "Date Picker",
   "Mode": "Datetime"
 },

The form cells that support this feature include:

  • Attachment Form Cell

  • DatePicker Form Cell
  • DurationPicker Form Cell
  • InlineSignatureCapture Form Cell
  • ListPicker Form Cell
  • Note Form Cell
  • SignatureCapture Form Cell
  • SimpleProperty Form Cell

For more information, see this  documentation.  

Introduce Additional Properties in Timeline Cell Control

With this release, MDK now supports displaying additional text properties‚Äîsuch as StatusText, SubstatusText, and Subattribute‚Äîon the right side of the timeline cell.

 

"StatusText": "Status1"
"SubstatusText": "Status2",
"Subattribute": "Subattribute",

For more information, see this  documentation.  

Support Viewing Password-Protected PDFs in Native File Viewer (Android only)

MDK now supports viewing password-protected PDF files in the native file viewer on Android.

Fiori Dialog box when opening a password protected PDF on Android

Enable Nested Scrolling on SectionExtension (Android only)

In case you're using a Section Extension control for a custom extension implementation and the height of the extension area cannot display the full content, you can use the new IsScrollable property in the Section Extension control to enable nested scrolling within the extension view.  The default setting is false.

Become and SAP MDK Explorer!
Do you have a requirement to build a mobile solution for your enterprise? Take your first steps today by following these tutorials to get started and learn more about the SAP Mobile development kit. We‚Äôre excited to see what you build‚Äîyour feedback and ideas are invaluable!

entry.title: SAP Build FAQ: Commercials, Getting Started and More
entry.content:
This FAQ provides an overview of‚ÄØSAP‚Äôs commercial offering of SAP Build. It covers the available commercial models for SAP Build and provides answers to questions that we most often hear regarding SAP Build commercial model, onboarding, metering and more. 

What is the SAP Build Unified Offering?‚ÄØ 

SAP Build has been designed as the optimal way to extend SAP S/4HANA Cloud and other business applications. Thousands of customers are already experiencing up to 3x faster development speeds with SAP Build according to‚ÄØrecent analyst research‚ÄØ‚Äî and now we‚Äôve made it even better. 

Combined with deep technical integration, SAP Builds unified offering empowers customers to quickly extend and personalize their business solutions using AI-powered application development and automation, while maintaining a clean core and eliminating additional licensing or budgeting complexity. 

What is included in the Unified SAP Build Offering?‚ÄØ 

 Customers can access the full range of SAP Build capabilities through just four distinct SKUs.  

  • SAP Build Base User is for end users who need to access applications, gain insights for day-to-day business needs, and approve tasks. 
  • SAP Build Premium User includes all the features of the base user license, with added capabilities for end users to author content, monitor processes, customize pages and deploy attended bots. 
  • SAP Build Developer includes all the features of the Premium User license, plus advanced capabilities for developers and architects who need full access to deployed assets. 
  • SAP Build Runtime Application hosting and lifecycle management services that support the creation and execution for dev/test as well as production environments 

How do I find out what is included in SAP Build?‚ÄØ 

  • For a list of services that are included in SAP Build you can visit the SAP Discovery Center, for SAP Build following this link 
  • To find out what is in each SKU, Base, Premium, Developer and Runtime you can visit the SAP Build Pricing Page here. 

What commercial models are SAP Build provided in?‚ÄØ 

Consumption Based Model:‚ÄØ 

  • SAP BTP Enterprise Agreement (BTPEA) 
  • SAP Cloud Enterprise Agreement (CPEA) 
  • Pay-As-You-Go for SAP BTP 

Subscription Based Commercial Mode:‚ÄØ 

  • Service Plan for SAP Build Subscription 

SAP Cloud ERP Private Edition:‚ÄØ 

  • SAP Build Entitlements are included in the SAP Cloud ERP Edition 
  • Find more about SAP Cloud ERP Edition here‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 
  • Find out more about the SAP Build offering in SAP Cloud ERP Private Edition here 

SAP Business Suite Packages: 

  • Entitlements are provided in several of the SAP Business Suite packages 

Partner: 

  • SAP Build offers partners free access to SAP Build and other BTP Services. 
  • SAP Build Test, Demo Development (the site requires you to be logged in as an SAP Partner) 
     

How do I get started with SAP Build?‚ÄØ 

SAP Build uses SAP BTPs Cloud Integration Automation (CIA) to quickly get customers and partners up and going on SAP Build.  Find information on how to setup SAP Build here.  For detailed instructions on the activation process, please share this blog post with your technical team 

Does SAP Build include Joule Studio and Joule for Developer?‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

Yes, SAP Build provides Joule for Developer and Joule Studio.  Joule Studio is provided with the SAP Build Developer offering.  Joule for Developer features are included, but will need to enable this through the free voucher SKUs.  You can find more information on Joule for Developer here and Joule Studio here. 

Are there specific service plans that are exclusive to the unified SAP Build offering? 

The Joule Studio service is only offered in the SAP Build Developer SKU. Joule for Developer needs to be enabled through the free voucher SKU's and then can only be used with the SAP Build offering, SAP Build Code and Joule for Developer, BTP ABAP Environment.  Visual Cloud Functions in SAP Build Apps is not available in the SAP Build unified SKU. 

Can I migrate from the previous SAP Build SKU‚Äôs to the new SAP Build SKU?‚ÄØ 
 
Upgrade you SAP Build licenses to access enhanced features and tools.  Use build-specific plans for improved efficiently and customization in your projects.   

For migration of services please refer to this help 

 Can I use both the Old and New Service plans within the same subaccount? 

 The old services cannot be enabled in the same subaccount as the new Build services.  You will need to do a migration per the above migration guide. 

 How does metering work, for example if I use both SAP Build Base User and SAP Build Developer capabilities? 

SAP Build operates on a metering model that relies on specific user roles to determine access and functionality within the platform, which include developer, base user, and premium user. Each user must have a global user ID created by an administrator, who also assigns the appropriate role collection to ensure that the correct authorization is granted. 

This role assignment is critical; for instance, an SAP Build base user shouldn't be able to create new processes within SAP Build, as such permissions could lead to unintended alterations or disruptions in workflows. By understanding and correctly implementing these roles, organizations can effectively manage user capabilities while maintaining the integrity and security of their SAP Build environment. 

For more detailed information on metering and roles visit this help location. 

 How can I learn more about SAP Build?‚ÄØ 

  •  SAP Build Basic Trial‚ÄìGet hands-on experience with a free, 30-day trial, following a step-by-step tutorial on SAP Build. 
  • SAP Discovery Center‚ÄìDive deeper with step-by-step guidance and best practices for implementing use cases.  
  • SAP Learning ‚ÄìDevelop SAP skills for free, anywhere, anytime, and at your own pace: SAP Build

entry.title: Custom Agentic Chatbot with SAP AI Core and Joule Studio ‚Äî Part 1
entry.content:
üöÄ Series Overview: Custom Agentic Chatbot with SAP AI Core and Joule Studio

  • Part 1 ‚Äî Building the Custom AI Agent Backend
  • Part 2 (1) ‚Äî Deploying the Agent on AI Core (Environment & Containerization)
  • Part 2 (2) ‚Äî Deploying the Agent on AI Core (Deployment & Testing)
  • Part 3 (1) ‚Äî Setting Up Joule Studio Connection (Destination & Environment)
  • Part 3 (2) ‚Äî Creating a Joule Skill (Design & Release)
  • Part 3 (3) ‚Äî Testing and Sharing on Work Zone

Agentic AI Chatbots in the Enterprise Context

Enterprises today need more than a chatbot that simply provides guidelines or answers FAQs. In real business contexts, users expect AI systems that can actually take action ‚Äî querying databases for insights, drafting or sending emails, and orchestrating multi-step workflows. This growing demand has led to the rise of agentic AI chatbots, which combine the familiarity of a conversational interface with the power to execute enterprise-scale tasks. While frameworks such as LlamaIndex, AutoGPT, and LangGraph enable orchestration, enterprises need robust deployment, seamless integration, and governance to run them at scale.

This blog series will walk through that journey step by step. We‚Äôll start by building a custom agent backend, then deploy it on SAP AI Core, and finally make it directly consumable from Joule Studio ‚Äî enabling business users to interact with the agent through a natural conversational interface inside Joule.

üöÄ To make the process easier to follow, we‚Äôve divided the content into three parts:

  • Part 1 ‚Äî Building the Custom AI Agent Backend 
  • Part 2 ‚Äî Deploying the Agent on AI Core 
  • Part 3 ‚Äî Integrating the Agent into Joule Studio 

By the end of this series, you will have a clear, reproducible path from

  1. Custom AI agent code in GitHub
  2. Scalable deployment on AI Core
  3. Business-ready conversational interface through Joule Studio.

 

Part 1 ‚Äî Building the Custom AI Agent Backend

In this first post, we focus on the backend logic of the custom agentic chatbot. This backend is implemented with Flask and exposes REST API endpoints that support both one-shot and multi-step interactions. While one-shot calls return only the final answer, the multi-step design allows the system to expose the agent‚Äôs reasoning process step by step, improving interpretability and transparency.

Custom AI Agent Chatbot Backend Capabilities 

For demonstration purposes, the backend is designed to handle common enterprise tasks such as:

  • Structured Data Access ‚Äì Query SAP HANA Database to support reporting, analytics, and decision-making.
  • Vector-based Retrieval ‚Äì Search SAP HANA Vector DB to enable advanced RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) use cases.
  • Enterprise Communication ‚Äì Manage enterprise emails (drafting, sending, or forwarding messages) through integration with existing systems.
  • External Information Retrieval ‚Äì Fetch context from real-world services (e.g., weather updates, web search results) to enrich responses.

API Endpoint Design for Agent Orchestration

In our implementation, we adopted LangGraph as the orchestration framework. Since the agent dynamically generates a plan first, and then builds a LangGraph structure based on that plan, it was natural to split the API into multiple steps:

/v2/plan ‚Üí /v2/action-graph ‚Üí /v2/start-execution ‚Üí /v2/continue-execution

This is just one way to design it. With a different orchestration style, you might merge steps into a single /chat endpoint or a simpler two step flow. 

Endpoint Summary:

MethodPathSummaryRequest Body
GET/v2/healthHealth check-
POST/v2/planStep 1. Generate planconversation_id, message
POST/v2/action-graphStep 2. Create action graphconversation_id
POST/v2/start-executionStep 3. Start Executionconversation_id
POST/v2/continue-executionStep 4. Complete Execution conversation_id
POST/v2/chatOne-shot chatconversation_id, message

These endpoints reflect how the workflow is divided into steps in our design. To make it more concrete, here's a minimal Flask example showing how each endpoint might look in practice.

Example Flask Code:

from flask import Flask, request, jsonify
import uuid

app = Flask(__name__)

# Health check
@app.route('/v2/health', methods=['GET'])
def health_check():
    return jsonify({"status": "healthy"})

# Step 1: Plan generation
@app.route('/v2/plan', methods=['POST'])
def generate_plan():
    """
    Example route for generating a plan.
    - Replace the stub logic with your own planner (LLM, LangGraph, rule-based, etc.).
    - Store the plan into session or external state manager if needed.
    """
    data = request.json or {}
    message = data.get('message','')
    session_id = data.get('conversation_id') or f"session-{uuid.uuid4().hex[:8]}"

    if not message:
        return jsonify({'error': 'Message is required'}), 400

    # TODO: Call planning logic here

    return jsonify({"conversation_id": session_id,
                    "type": "plan_generated",
                    "content": "<example plan object>"})

# Step 2: Action graph creation
@app.route('/v2/action-graph', methods=['POST'])
def generate_action_graph():
    """
    Example route for generating an action graph.
    - Replace with your real plan ‚Üí graph transformation.
    - Retrieve the plan from session or agent manager before creating the graph.
    """
    data = request.json or {}
    session_id = data.get('conversation_id')
    if not session_id:
        return jsonify({'error':'conversation_id is required'}), 400

    # TODO: Get planning state > Implement graph creation logic here

    return jsonify({"conversation_id": session_id,
                    "type": "action_graph_generated",
                    "content": "<example content you want to show user>"})

# Step 3: Start execution
@app.route('/v2/start-execution', methods=['POST'])
def start_execution():
    """
    Example route for starting execution.
    - Replace with logic to execute the first node of the action graph.
    """
    data = request.json or {}
    session_id = data.get('conversation_id')
    if not session_id:
        return jsonify({'error':'conversation_id is required'}), 400

    # TODO: Get action graph > execute the first node of the graph

    return jsonify({"conversation_id": session_id,
                    "type": "execution_started",
                    "content": "<example content you want to show user>"})

# Step 4: Continue execution
@app.route('/v2/continue-execution', methods=['POST'])
def continue_execution():
    """
    Example route for continuing execution.
    - Replace with logic to execute remaining nodes and return the final response.
    """
    data = request.json or {}
    session_id = data.get('conversation_id')
    if not session_id:
        return jsonify({'error':'conversation_id is required'}), 400

    # TODO: Get action graph > execute remaining nodes and return final response

    return jsonify({"conversation_id": session_id,
                    "type": "execution_complete",
                    "content": "<example content you want to show user>"})

# One-shot chat
@app.route('/v2/chat', methods=['POST'])
def chat():
    """
    Example route for one-shot chat.
    - Replace with your pipeline that runs plan ‚Üí graph ‚Üí execution in one step.
    """
    data = request.json or {}
    message = data.get('message', '')
    session_id = data.get('conversation_id')  # use conversation_id as session_id

    # TODO: Process agent pipeline here all at once

    return jsonify({"conversation_id": session_id,
                    "type": "execution_complete",
                    "content": "<example content you want to show user>"})

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run(host="0.0.0.0", port=5000)

‚ö†Ô∏è  Note: this is only an example. Replace the TODO sections with your own orchestration logic.

With this backend in place, we now have a clear foundation for orchesting multi-step agent workflows, from plan generation to action execution, all exposed via REST APIs.

 

üëâ  In the next part, we'll take this custom agent backend and deploy it on SAP AI Core: packaging the Flask service into a Docker container, creating a ServingTemplate, and exposing it as a production-ready endpoint.

entry.title: üöÄ SAP BTP Weekly | Innovaci√≥n segura, automatizaci√≥n inteligente y futuro sostenible
entry.content:
üõ°Ô∏è 1Ô∏è‚É£ Seguridad mejorada en BTP: rotaci√≥n autom√°tica de claves y CAPTCHA ampliado

üîπ SAP anunci√≥ en su Q3 2025 mejoras clave en Security & Identity Management. üîπ Incluye rotaci√≥n autom√°tica de claves de acceso, nuevos logs de aprovisionamiento en tiempo real y protecci√≥n CAPTCHA incluso para verificaci√≥n telef√≥nica. üîπ Tambi√©n llegan comandos de consola para certificados personalizados.

üí¨ An√°lisis: SAP sigue fortaleciendo la capa operativa de seguridad. La rotaci√≥n autom√°tica reduce riesgos humanos, pero exige revisar integraciones para que las apps soporten las nuevas claves. Adem√°s, las APIs y logs abren la puerta a integraciones con SIEM corporativos.

üìé Q3 2025 Quarterly Release Highlights: SAP BTP Security & IAM ‚ùì ¬øTus pipelines ya contemplan rotaci√≥n autom√°tica de credenciales o siguen siendo manuales?

üß± 2Ô∏è‚É£ Riesgos en arquitecturas h√≠bridas: seguridad entre BTP y el core

El crecimiento de BTP en entornos h√≠bridos trajo nuevos retos: ‚öôÔ∏è conexiones mal configuradas, üë§ cuentas t√©cnicas con privilegios excesivos, üö® y falta de monitoreo entre sistemas on-premise y cloud.

Onapsis recomienda aplicar el principio de menor privilegio, segmentar destinos y usar alertas de comportamiento an√≥malo.

üí¨ An√°lisis: La promesa del h√≠brido es flexibilidad, pero tambi√©n implica m√°s puntos vulnerables. Cada destino en BTP es una posible puerta lateral si no se gestiona bien. La buena noticia: SAP ya integra alertas y trazabilidad m√°s robustas; la mala, que muchas organizaciones a√∫n no tienen visibilidad unificada de sus conexiones. Un gobierno efectivo requiere mapear todos los destinos, controlar privilegios y automatizar validaciones.Para el CIO, esto no es un problema t√©cnico: es un riesgo reputacional si una brecha surge desde el entorno cloud.

üìé Securing the Bridge ‚Äì Onapsis

üéì 3Ô∏è‚É£ SAP TechEd 2025: confianza, IA y estrategia BTP

üìç Berl√≠n y online | 4‚Äì6 noviembre Este a√±o, SAP TechEd pone el foco en IA responsable, seguridad y automatizaci√≥n empresarial. La pista ‚ÄúBuilding Trust on BTP‚Äù mostrar√° c√≥mo aplicar IA generativa con cumplimiento normativo, y habr√° nuevas certificaciones en SAP Build y AI Developer.

üí¨ An√°lisis: TechEd siempre marca tendencias. Este a√±o, SAP busca demostrar que IA y seguridad no son opuestos, sino complementarios. La idea de ‚Äútrust by design‚Äù ser√° central: usar IA generativa bajo marcos de control auditables. Para los arquitectos, esto significa que el BTP no solo ser√° m√°s inteligente, sino tambi√©n m√°s predecible. Y para los l√≠deres de negocio, TechEd ser√° el momento de evaluar c√≥mo conectar Joule y Build con la realidad operativa.

üìé Agenda oficial SAP TechEd 2025

ü§ñ 4Ô∏è‚É£ Joule Studio y automatizaci√≥n inteligente

SAP Joule Studio permite crear agentes de IA sin c√≥digo directamente sobre Build Process Automation. Un CFO o analista puede describir en lenguaje natural un proceso, y Joule lo convierte en flujo automatizado. El reto: asegurar trazabilidad y control en automatizaciones generadas por usuarios.

üí¨ An√°lisis: Este paso cambia el juego: los procesos dejan de ser dise√±ados solo por TI. Con Joule Studio, √°reas como Finanzas o RRHH pueden construir automatizaciones √∫tiles en minutos. Sin embargo, el reto est√° en la gobernanza: definir qui√©n puede crear, auditar y modificar esos flujos. El CIO gana velocidad, pero debe mantener control. El equilibrio entre autonom√≠a y seguridad definir√° el √©xito.

üìé SAP Joule Studio

‚ôªÔ∏è 5Ô∏è‚É£ FinOps y sostenibilidad: control financiero y ambiental en una sola vista

SAP refuerza su visi√≥n ESG con Sustainability Control Tower y Green Ledger, integradas con BTP y S/4HANA Cloud. CFOs y COOs pueden medir impacto ambiental junto al financiero, automatizando reportes ESG. Combinado con FinOps, permite reducir gastos cloud y alinear sostenibilidad y rentabilidad.

üí¨ An√°lisis: El control financiero y la sostenibilidad se vuelven inseparables. BTP permite que el impacto ambiental se mida con el mismo rigor que el financiero. Para el CFO, significa tener visibilidad completa de costos y emisiones. Para TI, implica integrar m√©tricas ESG dentro de los procesos operativos. Este enfoque convierte la sostenibilidad en una ventaja competitiva, no en un ‚Äúcompliance m√°s‚Äù.

üìé SAP Sustainability Control Tower

üß© 6Ô∏è‚É£ Extensibilidad guiada: el ‚Äúwizard‚Äù que simplifica SAP Build y CAP

El nuevo Extensibility Wizard ayuda a construir extensiones seguras para S/4HANA desde BTP, asegurando compatibilidad con upgrades y manteniendo el clean core. Menos ‚Äúcustom code spaghetti‚Äù, m√°s agilidad y trazabilidad.

üí¨ An√°lisis: SAP da un paso firme hacia la estandarizaci√≥n de extensiones. El wizard facilita que incluso equipos sin experiencia profunda en ABAP construyan ampliaciones seguras y mantenibles. Esto acelera proyectos sin comprometer el core. El desaf√≠o: convencer a los equipos de desarrollo tradicionales de abandonar el ‚Äúcustom code‚Äù artesanal y adoptar un enfoque guiado, pero m√°s sostenible.

üìé Extensibility Wizard ‚Äì Blog SAP

üîó 7Ô∏è‚É£ Joule + Microsoft Copilot: colaboraci√≥n aumentada entre ecosistemas

La alianza SAP‚ÄìMicrosoft da un paso m√°s: Joule se integra con Microsoft 365 Copilot, permitiendo consultar y accionar datos SAP directamente desde Teams, Outlook o Excel. Ejemplo: ‚Äú¬øCu√°l fue el gasto real del Q3?‚Äù ‚Äî y Joule responde en segundos con datos de SAP Analytics Cloud. Una nueva forma de productividad aumentada, donde BTP se convierte en el puente entre AI empresarial y colaboraci√≥n diaria.

üí¨ An√°lisis: La frontera entre ERP y oficina se difumina. Con Joule + Copilot, un usuario puede consultar informaci√≥n cr√≠tica de SAP sin salir de Teams. Esto convierte la colaboraci√≥n diaria en un entorno de decisi√≥n asistida por IA. Para los CIOs, implica una nueva prioridad: gobernar el acceso a datos sensibles que ahora fluyen por herramientas colaborativas. Una integraci√≥n poderosa, pero que exige pol√≠ticas s√≥lidas de seguridad y contexto de uso.

üìé SAP + Microsoft AI Partnership

¬øQu√© equilibrio te resulta m√°s desafiante hoy? üëâ Seguridad üëâ Velocidad üëâ Gobernanza

D√©jamelo en los comentarios ‚Äî la transformaci√≥n BTP la construimos entre todos üí¨

entry.title: What's New in SAP BTP - Q3 2025
entry.content:
This third quarter brought some helpful innovation highlights for SAP Business Technology Platform, that we‚Äôre excited to share with you! The Q3 Innobytes demonstrate the progress we made in SAP BTP over the last months. Check out the video below and explore the latest features in Application Development, Joule and more. Enjoy watching!

 

App Dev Highlights

AI-powered Capabilities in SAP Build Work Zone

In the first demo, three new AI capabilities in SAP Build Work Zone are demonstrated to help you work smarter and more efficiently.

With AI Summarization, you can create a concise summary of long documents within seconds. Simply find the content in your workspace and click Summarize to save time and work smarter.

To make engaging with content easier, you can access AI Comment Generation via the AI icon to generate contextual comments, helping respond quickly and intelligently. 

To support content creation, the AI Text Generation helps with drafting an introduction or brainstorming ideas. In the workspace editor, you can ask AI to generate Text and let it support your experience in the SAP Build Work Zone.  

Watch the demo starting at 00:09 to see these innovations in action.

Learn more

  • Blog Post SAP Build Work Zone
  • SAP Build Work Zone
  •  SAP Community

 

Skill Builder in Joule General Availability

Welcome to Joule Studio, a powerful tool that enables you to create intelligent AI agents and custom-built Joule Skills based on your specific business needs.

The creation of Joule Studio‚Äôs AI agent is seamlessly integrated with SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP), leveraging its robust security, scalability, and connectivity to SAP systems for maximum efficiency. In this demo, a new Joule Skill is created that automates the workflow of the badge printing process. It automatically generates and prints employee badges by integrating Joule Studio with the SAP HR database, and everything you need for this process is in one place.

Start the demo at 01:51 to get more insights.

Learn more

  • Get Started with Joule Studio
  • Detailed Tutorial
  • SAP Community Blog Page

 

Downtime-Optimized Upgrades for SAP BTP ABAP Environment

SAP BTP ABAP Environment now uses blue-green-fashioned lifecycle management to minimize the downtime during hotfixes and version upgrades.

A recent update demonstrates that switching to a new runtime takes only seconds, with release upgrades targeting about 30 minutes. This innovation aims to make the process more transparent, aligning with downtime more efficiently. With this improvement, we are minimizing downtime and optimizing upgrades! 

This demo uses an example to highlight this innovation further (starting at 03:15).

Learn more

  • SAP BTP ABAP Environment ‚Äì Maintenance Windows and Major Upgrade Windows in 2025

 

Integration

AI Adapter in SAP Integration Suite

In August, we released an AI adapter for Cloud Integration capability of the SAP Integration Suite on the SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP).

Available as part of the Standard plan and above, it allows integration flows to interact with Large Language Models, adding AI directly into the integration at runtime. In this demo iflow, a product review is analyzed with OpenAI to enrich them with customer sentiment. This example shows the detection of a negative sentiment in a product review through GPT-5. The adapter is available now for you to try.

Watch this part (starting at 04:29) to get more insights.

Learn more

  • AI Adapter Blog Post
  • AI Adapter on SAP Business Accelerator Hub

 

Data & Analytics

SQL Generation for SAP HANA in Joule

In SAP Build Code, Joule can now automatically generate SAP HANA SQL based on natural language prompts.

You can either execute it directly within the Joule panel or you can copy the SQL command into the SQL Console to perform additional operations or refinements. This integration streamlines workflows, boosts productivity, and reduces errors, eliminating manual coding and tool switching.

This is how it‚Äôs done:

  1. Enable SQL generation using object definitions in your workspace‚Äôs settings
  2. Navigate to your Joule extension and select the command type HANA SQL
  3. Type your Natural Language Prompt ‚Äì Joule will then generate and execute the SQL for you
  4. Execute or add operations or refinements to the results

See these steps in action (starting at 05:57).

Learn more

  • Generate SQL from Natural Language using Joule

 

Cross

Modifiable Transport Requests

SAP Cloud Transport Management Service now supports Modifiable Transport Requests, allowing you to test and adjust transport requests in safe test nodes before releasing them to production.

This is how it works:

  1. Create a Modifiable Transport Request with the Create button.
  2. When opening the request, see the Tracking tab that shows the transport landscape and is now open for changes.
  3. Add content to the request and click the Test button to import directly or later and freely add or remove content.
  4. Release the request when testing is completed.

This flexible approach enables adding, removing, or redeploying content as needed, ensuring higher quality and safer deployments. Automation and Integration with other SAP BTP services are planned, so stay tuned for more to come.

To see this demo in action, watch the video (starting at 07:36).

Learn more

  • Modifiable Transport Request Blog Post

 

Cross (Cloud ALM)

Change Point Detection for Custom BTP Apps in SAP Cloud ALM

Running custom apps on SAP BTP embraces Cloud Flexibility with the Clean Core Principle. With the SAP Cloud ALM for Operations, you can monitor SAP and non-SAP applications end-to-end. This feature ensures business continuity and operational efficiency.

Real User Monitoring gives you clear insights into usage by tracking executions, performance, and response times all in one interface. 

If the performance suddenly shifts, Change Point Detection identifies unusual patterns in the performance compared to historical trends. You can then directly navigate to the respective request and even receive alerts or emails when a change point is detected. This helps quick investigation of the issue and ensures smooth operations.

This new feature is highlighted (starting at 08:52).

Learn more

  • SAP Cloud ALM for Operations Expert Portal
  • SAP BTP Developer‚Äôs Guide (Github)
  • Join us for TechEd:
  • CS101 | Discover SAP Cloud ALM for operations in action
  • CS261 | Monitoring a custom SAP BTP application with SAP Cloud ALM for operations

 

Share your thoughts 

These videos are for YOU, and we would love to hear your impressions. How do you like the video? How can we improve the upcoming videos? Please share your feedback by liking this post or leaving a comment below.

Thank you for your support and happy viewing, sharing, and enjoying!

You Might Also Be Interested In

  • SAP BTP Garage: monthly LIVE webinar with hands-on use case walkthroughs and demos.
  • Unlocking SAP BTP: monthly podcast covering all things SAP BTP.

entry.title: Custom Agentic Chatbot with SAP AI Core and Joule Studio ‚Äî Part 3 (3)
entry.content:
üöÄ Series Overview: Custom Agentic Chatbot with SAP AI Core and Joule Studio

  • Part 1 ‚Äî Building the Custom AI Agent Backend
  • Part 2 (1) ‚Äî Deploying the Agent on AI Core (Environment & Containerization)
  • Part 2 (2) ‚Äî Deploying the Agent on AI Core (Deployment & Testing)
  • Part 3 (1) ‚Äî Setting Up Joule Studio Connection (Destination & Environment)
  • Part 3 (2) ‚Äî Creating a Joule Skill (Design & Release)
  • Part 3 (3) ‚Äî Testing and Sharing on Work Zone

 

Part 3 (3) ‚Äî Testing and Sharing the skill on Work Zone

In the previous part, we designed a CustomAgent Skill that links your AI Core backend actions and defines how Joule interprets user inputs. Now, it‚Äôs time to test it live, right inside Joule Chat Interface, and finally share it with your organization‚Äôs via Work Zone, so that others can access your agent.

By the end of this section, you will:

  • Test your Skill in Joule Chat Interface
  • share the Skill to Work Zone for organization-wide access

 

1. Test the Skill in Joule Chat interface

Once your Skill is released and deployed to the environment, it becomes available inside the Joule Chat interface.

Step 1. Launch Joule Chat Interface
